perturbation.original_text:
This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the (“Agreement”) is entered into on January
11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as “Client”) and
Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as “Company”).
perturbation.changed_text:
This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the (“Agreement”) is entered into on January
11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as “Client”) and
Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as “Service Provider”).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Company' to 'Service Provider' introduces ambiguity. Throughout the document, 'Company' is used, but now a different term is introduced, creating uncertainty about whether they are the same entity or if different obligations apply to each.

perturbation.original_text:
1. Website Design and Development. Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the
“Contract Price”) to design and develop a website for Client (the “Client Website”) in accordance with the
accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
(a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this
Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a
“Change Order”. The costs of any such changes shall be added to the Contract Price. Additional Work
shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page
design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial
revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or
significant changes in the Scope of Work.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Website Design and Development. Client agrees to pay to the Service Provider the sum of $5,000 (the
“Contract Price”) to design and develop a website for Client (the “Client Website”) in accordance with the
accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
(a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this
Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by the Development Team in writing as a
“Change Order”. The costs of any such changes shall be added to the Contract Price. Additional Work
shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page
design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial
revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or
significant changes in the Scope of Work.
perturbation.explanation: The change of 'Company' to 'Service Provider' in the initial statement, and then to 'Development Team' creates confusion. Are they all the same? If not, who is responsible for accepting change orders?

perturbation.original_text:
4. Customer Service. Company, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide
customer service (the “Customer Service”) relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer
questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth.
Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at
its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to
provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
4. Customer Service. The Vendor, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide
customer service (the “Customer Service”) relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer
questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth.
Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. The Vendor at
its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to
provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to it.
perturbation.explanation: Switching from 'Company' to 'Vendor' introduces uncertainty. Are 'Vendor' and 'Company' the same? The paragraph includes both terms, leading to confusion about which entity is obligated to provide customer service and under what conditions.
